Hi all some food for thought.With the closure of SA next year  some of you are thinking of setting aside FRS of 426k at 55 to with $4460 at 70 hoping to live until 100 so he will collect $1.6m.but do u know that your 426k given to cpf at the age of 55 of compound 4% for 45 yrs would become $2.5m. so u think u r ripping cpf off by living longer but actually cpf still wins if they can generate 4% yield yoy with ur money.

Food for thought  slight correction to your calculations:426k compounded at 4% for 15 years with no withdrawals is 775k775k compounding at 4% but withdrawing $4460 monthly will only last you 21-22 years of withdrawals.So if you live till 100  you‚Äôre indeed getting a better deal from CPF than if you were to try and DIY your own CPF LIFE.It‚Äôs even worse if you tried to DIY CPF LIFE payouts starting from age 65  you would run out of money by the time you‚Äôre 80.

You're welcome to double check my numbers üôÇ I used the following calculators:https://www.360financialliteracy.org/Calculators/Savings-Distribution-Calculatorhttps://www.investor.gov/financial-tools-calculators/calculators/compound-interest-calculator
I‚Äôm for CPF life (but just at FRS levels).So I‚Äôm with you‚Ä¶.. hahahaha.

I can understand if someone is against it as a matter of principle cos it's a forced insurance scheme  if they say they want to control what they do with their money etc. etc.But if one accepts the idea that it is an insurance scheme  then naturally some must win and some must lose for it to mathematically work out for the cohort  and so if one's calculations show that everyone is losing badly either 1) something is very wrong with the system and no one has noticed 2) the calculations are wrongüòä
